job_description: Way back in 2009, two grads from Waterloo created Enflickwith a mission to deliver a better messaging solution that would empower people to stay closer with their friends and family. Today, TextNowand Touch Mobile, the company's two core products, are in the hands more than 40 million users worldwide and continue to grow exponentially.  We are the world's first all IP, cloud based, mobile phone carrier. Building clever systems and weaving technologies across platforms is what drives Enflick's growth. Of course we'll take good care of you during your time with us, but the excitement lies in our work. Work with us and impact the millions of people who rely on our products. If you want to change the rules of the game then we want to hear from you! As a UX Designer you will:Coordinate and execute the full UX design lifecycle - determine appropriate techniques and use them to arrive at design deliverables such as wireframes and IAConceptualize and design cutting edge features and interactions for Android, iOS, Windows and web appsIterate on existing designs based on feedback and experiment resultsProvide thoughtful and analytical design input and critiques for all design team deliverables Enflick Culture?We thrive on cleverness and freedomLike our product, our teams work seamlessly.Our space is open, casual and bright just the like the folks you'll work with.We're goal focused and everyone knows where we are headed because we talk about it.What's in it for you?Competitive Salary, Paid Vacation, Flexible hoursWe take excellent care of our people: From catered lunch daily to professional development to referral bonuses to corporate events (sports; soirees; socials)We provide the best tools while you are here with us: MacBook Pro, 27 Cinema Display, Smartphone device And finally, yes, we're in Waterloo!
job_requirements: Have or working towards:Passionate and experienced in UX design techniques and applicationSelf-starting with initiative and drive to make a differenceExperience as a UX designer within a high-tech field, preferably working on both mobile and web experiencesWilling to share a portfolio of projects demonstrating design methodologiesNice to have: Experience with Adobe Suite  Open To All Majors:No
